intro: Lavauxia howardii, commonly known as the Howard's lavauxia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
